items.title: Customer Happiness Executive, Weekends
items.content:
We're looking for someone to join our customer service team working a minimum of 16 hours over Saturday and Sunday, but with the opportunity to expand to more hours if required. The role is primarily home-based, but there will be some compulsory training based in Canary Wharf at the beginning of the role and at various times throughout your employment.

YourParkingSpace, recently named as one of the UK’s fastest growing companies by Leap 100, is looking for an enthusiastic and driven Customer Happiness Executive with a passion for the sharing economy to join our rapidly growing tech start-up company and drive our customer experience. We are aiming to transform the parking industry by providing a platform that enables motorists to find and book parking online. We’re fast-growing and looking for someone to join us in our Canary Wharf office to assist us in our constant growth.

As a Customer Happiness Executive, it is your responsibility to ensure that every customer leaves with a positive impression of YourParkingSpace.

Whether a customer has contacted us with a general query or a complaint you will need to be fast- acting, stay calm under pressure and remain positive throughout the interaction to ensure an exceptional customer experience is provided.

It’s necessary to expect the unexpected as unanticipated issues occur, you will need to be a keen problem-solver in order to handle any difficult situations which may arise.

You will play a crucial role within the team so as a remote operator you will need to be highly motivated, driven and passionate about the role. As a start-up we are still growing and learning as a company, therefore it is important to have the confidence to notify us of any recurring issues so that we can work to resolve these on mass to provide a better experience for all users.

The Role
Acting as the first point of contact for most customers
Communicating with users and potential users to give advice and answer any queries, in addition to resolving any complaints, often through thorough investigation.
Providing prompt responses, within set service level agreements, using our customer support software, Zendesk
Driving sales by negotiating terms with users of the site
Achieving monthly sales targets as part of a team effort

The Right Person
Experience in a customer-facing role
Able to communicate to an excellent standard both written and verbally
Exceptional computer skills
Keen attention to detail
Focused with the ability to self-motivate

items.title: Schedugram: Lead Engineer / Head of Engineering (MEAN Stack)
items.content:
Lead Engineer / Head of Engineering (MEAN Stack)

Posted Feb 7

Schedugram
Headquarters: Melbourne, Australia
https://schedugr.am

We are Schedugram, a company based in Australia but with a global remote team. We help marketing managers and agencies schedule their Instagram content. Our customers range from small businesses to Fortune 500 companies around the globe.

We have been growing significantly for the last 4 years. 

Now, we’re searching for a lead engineer who will turbocharge our existing team, hire more talent when it’s needed, streamline our development output and take responsibility for our code base.

Our whole company works remotely, so you will be working with people from across the globe every day.

Our stack:

We use a MEAN stack.

  • NodeJS / Express
  • MongoDB
  • AngularJS (1)
  • Redis for session management
  • RabbitMQ for messaging

We also have a mobile application in React Native.

We use AWS extensively, from Lambda functions to S3 and of course EC2. 

For VCS and issue management we use GitHub. We use Slack to communicate within the team. 

What we’re looking for

You will help our team to grow and provide best practice guidance to make sure we are building the right software at the right time. 

You: 

  • understand that the job of a tech startup is to ship product that customers use and love
  • love to write code, because that’s your main job with us
  • have deep expertise in our stack so that you can hit the ground running
  • will create decision matrices for major architectural decisions
  • will maintain a clean code base
  • will maintain documentation as needed (although we are not over documenting)
  • will create and enforce code guidelines
  • will manage the team and help them improve their coding skills
  • take ownership of our whole technical stack and delivery
  • are able to discuss technical issues with our non-technical teams
  • will be excited to celebrate success as you and your team release products and features that customers around the globe love

You're not a middle manager – you aren't afraid to roll up your sleeves and cut code, and you do it often. You demonstrate best practice first hand by showing it, rather than talking about it.

Your background

Our ideal candidate will have:

  • 5+ years in software development
  • Deep experience with the MEAN stack recently
  • 2+ years experience leading (managing) and growing a small engineering team
  • Experience working remotely, including communicating with a remote team spread across the world
  • Experience at a small rapidly growing startup (B2B SaaS preferred)
  • Knowledge in agile best practice development methods and delivery technologies
  • Experience teaching others best practices and mentoring junior developers
  • Full time availability – this role is 'all in', and you will be responsible for all of the moving parts of our technology

We'd love to chat more about how you can be part of Schedugram's next phase of growth.

Apply for this position

Apply at the link: https://schedugr.freshteam.com/jobs/qxM_dgrcKC0f/lead-engineer-head-of-engineering-mean-stack

items.title: Lead Software Developer / Technical Project Manager at MapLarge () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Business Intelligence, Data & Analytics, Developer APIs
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

100% Remote: This role allows working remotely 100% of the time from anywhere in the US.  Workers must be authorized to work in the US (No Non US Applicants Please). 

Who We Need: We are looking for talented software developers to act as lead developers in a customer facing, technical project manager role.  Applicants should have a strong history as a lead software developer (no non-technical project managers, please) and should be a top notch C# and JavaScript programmer.  We are looking for sophisticated team members who are passionate about not only how UI is used, but also how the APIs, ontology, data structures, documentation, and examples come together to make both the UI components and technical APIs a pleasure for customers to use.

Typical Tasks: Typical Tasks include both writing code and leading planning activities.  You will often be acting as the lead technical point of contact on customer engagements, running internal and external planning meetings, helping to wireframe user interfaces, creating specs for the public facing APIs that drive them, doing deep dive code reviews with developers, and writing code for key portions of the deployed application.

Skills: While we hire all kinds of people and invent roles to fit them, these are the key traits we prefer for this role:

  1. Smart & High Energy Engineer - We work at a very fast pace on cutting edge hard problems and we need people who can keep up.   We need people who really love producing results for customers and who enjoy programming and exhibit the energy and creativity that comes from being fully engaged in the technical side of what we do.
  2. Strong Software Development background - This job is definitely NOT for non technical project managers. Recent, hands-on experience coding both server side (C#) and client side (JavaScript) are strongly suggested, and 5+ years work experience as a professional programmer is required.  
  3. Experience Wireframing UI & Designing APIs - You do not have to have strong artistic skills, but you should be comfortable not only spec-ing out UI wireframes but also designing the supporting technical web service API’s and/or client side component API’s.
  4. Technical Project Management:  You should be highly organized with a strong history in either technical project management or as the lead developer for complex software development projects.  
  5. Customer Facing: comfortable meeting with sophisticated customers and managing expectations on large high value projects.

About MapLarge

MapLarge provides Big Data Analytics and Visualization to make the world safer, more productive, and more efficient.  The MapLarge API provides real time geospatial and predictive analytics for over 15 billion location events per day and trillions of historical events. Analysts using our geospatial visualization capability can instantly query and visualize data on any desktop, mobile or tablet device.  All of our UI components are re-usable, data driven, event driven, API powered (client and server side), scriptable, re-configurable, savable, deep linkable, shareable etc.  We also have editor components, and data visualization wizards that allow non-technical users to import, automatically visualize data patterns (with sensible defaults that “just work”), conduct predictive analysis and also re-configure more advanced detailed settings with “what you see is what you get” editor tools.

Benefits

Flexible Hours (work whenever you like)
No Commute (work from home 100%)
Technically Excellent A+ Team solving very hard interesting problems
Friendly People - Postitive attitude is our #1 criteria
401k
We like all kinds of people
Unlimited Vacation
Family Friendly
Top Notch Health Care
Cutting Edge Tech

items.title: Account Manager at Platform.sh () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Continuous Delivery, PaaS
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Company presentation :

Platform.sh is a groundbreaking hosting and development tool for web applications. We’re a European VC-Backed startup with a host of blue-chip Enterprise clients and a string of awards and grants (including €2m from the EU Horizon 2020 program). To reinforce our technical prowess, we are looking to grow our Customer Solutions team with an engineer that also enjoys customer relations. If you’re looking for an exciting, high-growth opportunity with an award-winning, cutting-edge company, this could be just the job for you.

Our customers run thousands of web applications in over 100 countries consuming 10s of thousands of CPUs on multiple public clouds. We were shipping containers before Docker, our sales team can explain the CAP Theorem, and our marketing director programs Haskell.

We can clone whole running systems, including the data, services, and networking in a matter seconds. The main API to operate and orchestrate our clusters of LXC containers is Git. We're hardcore technologists with equally hardcore customers.

We're looking for strong technologists who are good at providing valuable services directly to customers.

Our customers run thousands of web applications in over 100 countries consuming 10s of thousands of CPUs on multiple public clouds. We were shipping containers before Docker, our sales team can explain the CAP Theorem, and our marketing director programs Haskell.

We can clone whole running systems, including the data, services, and networking in a matter seconds. The main API to operate and orchestrate our clusters of LXC containers is Git. We're hardcore technologists with equally hardcore customers.

We're looking for strong technologists who are good at providing valuable services directly to customers.

Mission :

Our Account Managers are the ambassadors for the Platform.sh brand. They know the intricate needs and challenges of the customers in their portfolio and deeply care about their success. They lead communications in times of change or problem resolution, and foster a healthy working relationship with the customer.

Mission :

Sales activity for existing customers:

  • ensure renewal of contracts, including up and cross sells
  • report on renewal activity
  • liaise with sales team when necessary

Customer care:

  • be involved in the customer’s journey from on-boarding to continued partnership
  • monitor and measure Customer satisfaction (eg. Net Promoter Score) through regular health checks
  • coordinate the involvement of company personnel, including support, service, and management resources, in order to meet account performance objectives and customers’ expectations
  • solve conflicts and concerns that were not solved at Customer Support level
  • build and manage workflows for handling complaints

Technical Skills :

  • SaaS business acumen
  • relational and negotiation skills
  • ability to effectively prioritize and escalate customer issues as required
  • ability to learn and assimilate technical information quickly
  • fluent written and verbal English
  • basic knowledge of web application architecture and services (DNS, CDN, web servers, databases, cache layers, etc.) and distributed systems.
  • basic knowledge of web development workflows and tools (git, CI tools)
  • knowledge of common web applications and frameworks: Magento Ecommerce, Symfony, Drupal, eZ Platform, or Typo3 (a lot of our customers run those)
  • knowledge of cloud services (AWS, Azure)

Soft Skills :

  • customer orientation
  • sense of service
  • energetic and self-motivated
  • communication and listening skills
  • analytical, problem solving and troubleshooting expertise
  • organization
  • pragmatism
  • capacity to work remotely in an international fast growing environment
  • high degree of ownership over one’s work

About Platform.sh

We’re a venture capital funded, award-winning team of hard-core hackers who want to revolutionize the way that developers and agencies build and deploy web applications. We’re mostly distributed, but we meet up daily in cyberspace, and occasionally in Paris, France.  We value enthusiasm, team spirit, and a constant desire to expand personal knowledge and contribute to the community. We provide a multi-cultural, casual and balanced work environment. We recently helped launch Magento Enterprise Cloud Edition and the Sensio Cloud on Platform.sh technology.

Benefits

Work from home, wherever you are
Safe and friendly working environment
Stock options for everyone
Rest and recovery are essential to health and happiness; we get that

items.title: Dataquest | SF | Director of Marketing | Remote, Full-time | $90k - $130k | https://www.dataquest.io
items.content:
Dataquest | SF | Director of Marketing | Remote, Full-time | $90k - $130k | https://www.dataquest.io

At Dataquest, we teach data science interactively online to hundreds of thousands of students worldwide. We're focused on teaching skills and building intuition from the ground up with our project based curriculum. Unlike most educational options, we focus on motivating students to learn, not just content delivery. We have students go from no programming knowledge to jobs at companies like SpaceX, Amazon, and Microsoft, and you can read their stories here -- https://www.dataquest.io/stories .

Help us build awareness of Dataquest by scaling our marketing team, analyzing metrics, and running experiments with new growth channels. This is a chance to help students around the world learn while having a lot of ownership over the direction and messaging of the company. Ideally, you'll have experience with running and optimizing ads, analyzing data, and optimizing conversion funnels.

We're a bootstrapped team of 11, and we've been growing 2-3x per year since we launched in 2015, primarily through content marketing. We're looking for someone who can meaningfully increase this growth rate.

If you're burnt out doing work that doesn't feel like it has a direct impact, you have a passion for data science, or you want to peek inside a profitable bootstrapped company, this role could be a good fit.

Please email vik@dataquest.io if you're interested.

items.title: World Business and Executive Coach Summit (WBECS): Marketing Director
items.content:
Marketing Director

Posted Feb 1

World Business and Executive Coach Summit (WBECS)
Headquarters: Milton Keynes, UK
http://www.wbecs.com/wbecs2017/

Imagine being a leader in the team behind the world’s largest online event for professional Coaches. Working with the very top thought leaders in Business and Executive Coaching including professors from Harvard University and leading academic institutes. Working directly with the coaches of thought leaders like Richard Branson, Steve Jobs, Elon Musk, NASA, the President of the World Bank and other world leaders. Those are the coaches we work with personally to help get their amazing thought leadership out to the world and due to our fast growth we are looking for an exceptional new team member to join us.

Following running the world’s largest online event for coaches with 50 of the top thought leaders for the coaching industry we then identify one or two of the very best to work with on an individual project to launch one of their programs to the world. The last project we worked on was Narrative Coach, see www.narrativecoach.com. The project you would start working on would be www.ciqcoach.com followed by www.wbecs.com.

The role of Marketing Director is incredibly important and will involve developing the marketing efforts behind major launches of high class educational programs and learning environments for Business & Executive Coaches. You will be greatly supported by our senior leaders, as well as an incredible launch team -- and must have experience planning, building marketing campaigns and have extensive experience in Digital Marketing & Management.

This is not your typical office job. Our passionately engaged team works 100% remote  and collaborates vigorously. The lifestyle design is flexible, but full on and the culture is fast-paced. We consider our work our “art” and strive for excellence in everything we do.

You are the person we are looking for if you:

  • Have a minimum of 3-5 years of digital marketing project management experience.
  • 2-4 years building, testing and optimizing effective sales conversion funnels.
  • Love the idea of getting deep inside a world leading brand and developing its meaning, impact and perception in our global marketplace.
  • Have a deep love for online sales and digital marketing.
  • Have an understanding and hands-on experience with online funnel-based marketing.
  • Are tech savvy, can find your way around anything online and have mastered Google Applications and preferably Google Analytics.
  • Have a working knowledge of the web development process.
  • Ability to manage a database with careful attention to detail.
  • Have in-depth marketing automation experience.
  • Love the personal growth and development industry and want to make a positive impact on the world through the work you do.
  • Care about the world and people in it and want to support them in becoming successful in helping others.
  • Are a confident, resourceful and a highly motivated self-starter who can work independently and don’t require someone looking over your shoulder all day.
  • Thrive on problem-solving and have excellent team collaboration skills.
  • Have high standards for your work. Details matter to you. Results matter to you. Excellence matters to you.
  • Are invigorated by the constant change of a high-growth organization with bold and audacious goals.
  • Have a very high standard of quality to maintain, a very particular brand voice and work fast.
  • Speak English at an idiomatic level.
  • Are highly organized, with lots of initiative to stay on top of deadlines.
  • Have the ability to run a motivated and talented team across the globe.
  • Have the ability to delegate effectively and efficiently while keep a team passionate and motivated.
  • Marketing agency experience a bonus.
  • Above else, a willingness to learn as this is not an exhaustive list of what you will be working on!

What you’ll do:

  • Create and maintain world-class brands to drive community members into our desired action.
  • Build, optimize and drive the execution of a digital marketing campaign from start to finish.
  • Manage and meet all deadlines for a successful launch of a high-impact, high ticketed program.
  • Maintain a clean, segmented database inside Infusionsoft and create behaviorally triggered marketing automation to engage and grow our client community.
  • Ensure accurate, consistent data management and reporting in Infusionsoft and other reporting platforms for all sales and marketing related activities.
  • Continually develop, test, measure, and optimize campaigns to drive significant
    membership growth and maximize retention over time.
  • Analyze campaign performance data through reporting tools and communicate the results to the team.

Compensation: Better than competitive base (70-80k) with bonuses and unlimited growth opportunities, PLUS the most unique work environment that includes bonuses in the form of amazing trips to Countries like Costa Rica, Thailand, Croatia, and beyond as a reward for successful launches!  

***Most importantly, you will be working with our team that considers itself a family of people who will welcome you with open arms. We are based around the globe, so this position is 100% remote.  Primary working hours are US Eastern Time based and require flexible hours during program launches.

To apply, please send:
  1. Answers to the questions listed here:  https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdE2rddzYx6AcsLYVonZ4ep1z9PmtAPpySJN-RHiRajlaYnNg/viewform
  2. A cover letter explaining why you are an excellent fit for this role and this epic team
  3. Your resume to annemarie@wbecs.com with the subject line: Marketing Director

NOTE:  Applicants who do not answer the questionnaire or submit a cover letter will not be considered.

Apply for this position

Follow instructions in job description.

items.title: The Art of Applying: Executive Assistant to Founder & CEO
items.content:
Executive Assistant to Founder & CEO

Posted Feb 1

The Art of Applying
Headquarters: New York, NY (formerly Austin, TX)
http://theartofapplying.com/ea

Work from Home for a Woman Entrepreneur Helping Make People’s Dreams Come True


Position: Executive Assistant to the Founder & CEO of The Art of Applying

Compensation: $30,000 per year with 10 paid vacation days

Work hours: Full Time: Monday - Friday 9 am – 6 pm Eastern Time with an unpaid one-hour lunch.
Please note that working part-time or working nights and weekends only is not an option.

Location: Remote (must be located in the United States or Canada)

Deadline to apply: Wednesday, February 7 at 8 am Eastern Time

Start Date: March 1, 2018

The Art of Applying is a fast-growing education company that helps people from all over the world get admitted to their dream graduate schools with funding to pay for it.

We’re looking for an enthusiastic, reliable self-starter with excellent communication skills and a willingness to learn user-friendly technology such as WordPress, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Basecamp, and Zoom to join our 100% remote team (yes, you’d get to work from home!) as the Executive Assistant to the Founder & CEO.

How would you like to be with a company that helps people get into their dream graduate schools with funding that is at the very beginning of a significant growth phase?

A company that is willing and able to teach you everything you need to know to succeed?

A company that is more concerned about who you are as a person than about your job history or your experience?

A company that wants to give you the training and the opportunity you’ve been looking for?

A company that has twice-yearly all expenses paid company retreats? Our last retreat was in Austin, Texas and included beating a difficult Escape Game, a dessert reception with some of our clients, touring the city, one-hour massages, and eating the world’s best BBQ. Yeehaw!

With hard work and a willingness to learn, you will have the opportunity to build your skills, contribute to an amazing mission, have fun with like-minded people, and do it all while working from home.

Examples of job duties:

  • respond to incoming email inquiries from prospective clients using Helpscout
  • listen to one call recording per week of our Breakthrough Coaches to check that they are providing the absolute best service possible to prospective clients during their free 90-minute Breakthrough Calls
  • schedule professional and personal meetings for the CEO
  • conduct 45-minute onboarding calls with new clients via Zoom to help them understand how everything works in their client portal
  • manage the company’s business Facebook and Twitter accounts using a tool such as Edgar
  • help create the schedule and then serve as the logistics point person for the next team retreat (It will most likely be in New York City in June 2018)

Who we aren’t looking for:
  • people afraid of technology or who are proud to be “not computer savvy”
  • people interested in a remote role so they can travel several months out of the year
  • people who want to start their own business or build their own brand

Apply for this position

Submit your application here: http://theartofapplying.com/ea

items.title: Senior Clinical Project Manager / Program... - Barrington James - Remote
items.content:
Senior Clinical Project Manager / Program...
Barrington James -Remote
Permanent
Position: Senior Clinical Project Manager / Program Manager

Location: London, however flexible with home based working

Reporting Line: VP, Clinical Development

Size: Small yet growing!

Retained Search

Our client is an attractive, stable (yet small), fast-growing organisation based in the UK & US that focus on the development of Urological and Gastroenterology fields. This is an extremely exciting time for the company following a huge investment from various venture capitalist firms, therefore they have the platform to continue to grow across various indications and phases.

This is a great opportunity to join a young and exciting company from the get go and have the autonomy to truly impact the organization. This company have a truly talented senior management team with experience across blue chip pharma and small pharmaceutical companies, therefore the selected individual will have regular access to proven pharmaceutical professional enabling you to expand your portfolio!

Due to the companies unique stance in the market (huge financial backing, yet small in size), the selected candidate will have the opportunity to make a real difference! (i.e. small team culture and entrepreneurial environment where decisions are made quickly without red tape, while also having the stability/financial backing through there series A funding)

Attractive Features:
  • Huge financial backing = opportunity & stability
  • Experience yet transparent senior management team
  • Growth potential – due to several project ongoing, the company is going from strength to strength!
  • Opportunity to experience further development in Program Management
  • location & flexibility
Position Summary:
The Senior Clinical Project Manager (SCPM) will work closely with the VP, Clinical, to manage assigned global clinical studies of varying complexity (Phase 1 – 3). The SCPM is responsible for the management of all sites and vendors (e.g. Clinical Research Organisation, CRO) for each assigned clinical study and resolution of operational issues.

Main Responsibilities (please ask for full JD to see extended responsibilities)

  • Program Management
  • Clinical Study Management
  • Vendor Oversight
  • Budget Responsibilities
  • Stakeholder Responsibilities
  • Cooperate Responsibilities
Minimum experience requirements:
  • Clear track record of successful execution of clinical studies from Phase 1 through Phase 3 including:
o Detailed understanding of all aspects of clinical protocol design and implementation and overall drug development.

o Strong vendor management skills, e.g. CRO, Laboratory and Clinical Supply logistics.

o Management of clinical study to budget and timelines.

o Ability to write and edit technical documents such as protocols, protocol amendments, informed consent and other study-related documents.

  • Strong people-management skills and ability to interact and influence successfully at all levels and externally with Board Members, partners and others as necessary.
  • Knowledge of ICH guidelines, GxP regulations, FDA guidance documents, EU directives.
For more information, please reach out to me directly!

wpenticost@barringtonjames.com

+44 1293 77 66 44

Barrington James is a uniquely successful specialist life science recruitment company and has recently been recognised as a BEST COMPANY To Work For by the Sunday Times. It has enjoyed an exceptional growth trajectory since its launch in 2002, and is now established in the heartlands of the international pharma, medical devices and healthcare industry with consultant staff already approaching 140, and planned to be 180 by the end of 2017.

Recruitment companies succeed by matching the specific needs of clients with the true capabilities of candidates. We believe there are 2 reasons for our outstanding performance over the past decade, which benefit our clients and our candidates equally; People & Knowledge Barrington James’ exceptional people and their depth of experience are ready to work for you, now.

o Ability to write and edit technical documents such as protocols, protocol amendments, informed consent and other study-related documents.

  • Strong people-management skills and ability to interact and influence successfully at all levels and externally with Board Members, partners and others as necessary.

items.title: Outbound Telesales Executive - Onify Ltd - Remote
items.content:
Outbound Telesales Executive
Onify Ltd -Remote
£18,000 - £25,000 a year - Full-time, Permanent

Fancy yourself as a telesales Rockstar? Do you want to be part of the core team in a new startup with huge ambitions? If you answered yes, read on. We have something very exciting to tell you about.

ONIFY is a fast growing startup built around loyalty, customer retention and rewards. Ever wondered why you keep all those loyalty cards? Now you don’t have to. ONIFY rewards your loyalty without you having to carry, collect and locate all those annoying paper cards. Now, you can keep them all on one simple-to-use app and access them at any time.

For businesses, this gives them a complete marketing and customer retention system, with no technology required in-store. No longer are these tools just available to the big players, we are putting them in that hands of everybody so businesses can focus on what they do best. We help them get their customers back through the door time and time again. We believe that we everyone should be rewarded for being loyal to local, independent businesses and ONIFY provides the tools to do just that.

We love our product, and businesses and customers love it as well. We now need to get it in the hand in as many businesses as possible and need somebody to contact potential customers and guide them through the FREE sign up process. This role will be a mix of cold calling, building and maintaining a sales pipeline.

Our team have built marketplaces from scratch before, and we are doing it again with ONIFY. In a brand new role for us, you will be working under the direction of the CEO (founder of fillmybelly.com and Ex Just Eat director), whilst gaining a valuable insight into what it takes to build a company from the ground up, as well as understanding how everything we do affects the growth of the company.

Key skills required:

  • Experience within a sales or telesales environment is a must
  • Self-motivation and ability to work remotely
  • Must be energetic and love what you do
  • A pleasant and confident telephone manner, able to speak to people at various levels of business
  • Able to demonstrate first-class, effective business to business communication
  • Able to handle rejection with the desire to hit targets
  • You will have good literacy and numeracy skills
  • Good IT skills and knowledge of CRM.
  • Monitor and update all sales related KPI’s

ONIFY are looking for an individual who is passionate about sales and can work hard and think positive in a fast-paced sales environment. A strategic thinker, with the ability to work effectively under pressure and be able to prioritise and meet sales targets and KPI's.

We are a remote business, which means all our employees currently work from a location that suits them. If you've never worked remotely before, don’t worry, you’ll soon grow to love it. We have daily video catch ups, weekly meetings and regular chat on our communication networks, so you won’t ever feel on your own for the day.

This position is full time, however, your hours can be flexible to fit around your personal circumstances and needs of the business. Access to a computer, fast internet and a quiet place to work from are essential. There will be a solid basic salary as well as tiered commision levels to really help incentivise your sales ability.

If this sounds perfect for you, please apply with a covering letter explaining why you would be perfect for the role along with your current CV. We will not be reviewing applications that don’t have a covering letter attached, so please include one if you are seriously interested in becoming part of our team.

We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £18,000.00 to £25,000.00 /year

Required experience:

  • telesales: 1 year

items.title: Business Development Manager - Tompkins International - Remote
items.content:
Business Development Manager
Tompkins International -Remote
Business Development ManagerGroup: MonarchFx | Sales and Business DevelopmentLocation: Remote OfficePosition Type: Full Time | ExemptThe Business Development Manager is responsible for new customer acquisition and to accelerate revenue achievement. The primary function of this position is to focus on new client business development and growing the qualified sales opportunities. The Business Development Manager will focus on expanding the Company’s pipeline with new business opportunities and requires cold calling on new clients to generate sales. This position promotes the Company’s initiatives to grow our brand image and industry awareness through educating prospects on MonarchFx Alliance’s services.Essential Job Functions:
  • Develop new business growth strategies to continuously identify leads and prospects for new customers clients using multiple channels.
  • Analyze and research the Company’s market to identify opportunities and develops relationships with high-level contacts at prospective customers.
  • Communicate with prospects by phone and/or written correspondence.
  • Research and qualify select leads from partners and other sources.
  • Schedule introductory meetings by phone or onsite.
  • Organize and tracks all business development leads and maintains accurate data files on prospects in CRM software.
  • Continually target companies and individuals with the excellent long-term potential to grow future prospective pipelines.
  • Work with team members to help develop and maintain a targeted prospect list and execute business development campaigns with active and qualified prospects.
  • Performs related duties as assigned to grow revenue.
    • Qualifications and competencies:
  • A Bachelor’s Degree in Communications, Liberal Arts, Finance, Business, or related field and a minimum of 5 to 8 years of business development or lead generation experience in a B2B environment is required.
  • Hunter mentality is an absolute MUST.
  • Experience in the logistics, supply chain, 3PL, software or technology sector is preferred.
  • Proficient in Social Media platforms
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office applications including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint and Excel.
  • Skilled in persuasive oral and written communications, including the ability to engage in meaningful conversations with all levels of an organization.
  • Strong ability to build and manage a strategic network, and create rapport with all levels of an organization.
  • Ability to take a leadership role to drive change within the organization and for external engagements. Leadership: Integrity, honesty, accountability, creativity, a commitment to the team environment, and the ability to lead change.
  • Ability to plan, organize, execute, document and communicate goals/activities.
  • Ability to think, plan and execute the effective penetration of vertical markets, prospective accounts, and upper management.
  • Ability to take the initiative and act independently as appropriate situations dictate.
    • MonarchFx is a smarter logistics solution comprised of best-in-class supply chain companies focused on delivering cost-effective, high service level fulfillment solutions to brands and retailers.Tompkins International is a supply chain consulting and implementation firm that maximizes supply chain performance and value creation. We enable clients to be more profitable and valuable, while also becoming more agile, flexible, and adaptive to the marketplace. Tompkins collaborates with client teams to develop improved operations strategies, supply chain planning, and execution across all the Mega Processes of supply chains (Plan- Buy- Make- Move- Distribute- Sell).

items.title: Enterprise Program Manager - Healthcare 1 - Agfa - Home Based
items.content:
Enterprise Program Manager - Healthcare 1
Agfa -Home Based

Agfa HealthCare, a member of the Agfa-Gevaert Group, is a leading global provider of diagnostic imaging and healthcare IT solutions. The company has nearly a century of healthcare experience and has been a pioneer on the healthcare IT market since the early 1990's. Today, Agfa HealthCare designs, develops and delivers state-of-the-art systems for capturing, managing and processing diagnostic images and clinical/administrative information for hospitals and healthcare facilities, as well as contrast media solutions to enable effective medical imaging results. The company has sales offices and agents in over 100 markets worldwide.

Serving as the face of Agfa, the Enterprise Program Manager must gain visibility to the customer’s strategy and competing projects then leverage that knowledge to identify risks and opportunities. Additionally, must build relationships with customer key stakeholders outside of IT or the core team focused solely on Enterprise Imaging (EI). Leveraging positive customer relationships into new opportunities that aligns with strategic direction of both the customer and Agfa Healthcare

This is a home based position and can be located in any of the following cities and surrounding areas, close to a major airport. Travel is required to meet with clients and other stake holders.

Salt Lake City,UT, Nashville, TN, Denver, CO, Los Angeles, CA, Atlanta, GA, Boston, MA, Philadelphia, PA, Chicago, IL

Major responsibilities:

  • Gain an understanding of the overall EI platform and leverages that knowledge to ensure continued distribution of the solution capabilities across the customer’s organization.
  • Ensure all aspects of project success are met through the execution of project work plans in accordance with project’s Statement of Work (SOW). Revising the SOW as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements.
  • Manage activities of Project Team members, ensuring completion of assigned tasks in accordance with schedule, resources, cost, performance, and quality objectives.
  • Meet and collaborate with internal and external stake holders to effectively communicate project expectations in a timely and clear manner.
  • Efficiently identify and solve project issues as they arise in a proactive manner.
  • Identify and manage project dependencies and critical path.
  • Ensure all Agfa Healthcare quality documents required for the project’s deployment type are accurately completed, signed and posted.
  • Meet on-time commitments for project’s Service Acceptance and Final Acceptance.

Knowledge & Skills:

  • Advanced knowledge of current IT and Healthcare technologies
  • Working knowledge of hospital departmental workflow is required
  • Specific experience with EMR and/or RIS deployments for multi-site institutions.
  • Inspires others to meet deadline and work according to project management principles.
  • Goes beyond resolving immediate problem and takes initiative to identify like situations where the problem has not occurred, but could, and implements preventative measures.
  • Creates and acts on opportunities for interactions that lead to strong partnerships within and external to the organization.
  • Is a master presenter and draws a crowd, leaving them with the sense that his or her presentation was well worth their time.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with excellent negotiation, facilitation and conflict resolution skills
  • Proven presentation preparation and delivery skills to a diverse audience from C-suite to end users
  • Exemplary written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong executive presence

Education:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, MIS, Computer Science, Healthcare or related field. MBA, MPA, MHA or related Master’s degree is preferred

Certifications:

  • PMP (Project Management Professional) Certification required
  • CIIP, ITIL or related industry certifications are beneficial

Experience:

  • 5-10 years project management with 3-5 years in healthcare IT project management
  • Successfully deployed complete PACS system and RIS or Cardiology suite
  • Change Management know-how, C-Suite expertise, and Executive management skills
  • Experience translating a SOW into an actionable plan
  • Experience leading conversations with steering committees

We offer a rewarding career in a field that impacts lives, the opportunity to work with a talented and committed team of individuals, training and career development programs, and a competitive compensation and benefits package. If you want to be part of this experience, we'll take you there!

Learn more about Agfa HealthCare and follow us on Twitter.

Agfa HealthCare Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities/Women/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans.

items.title: Enterprise Sales Executive (SoCal) - Cordial - Remote
items.content:
Enterprise Sales Executive (SoCal)
Cordial -Remote
Enterprise Sales Executive (SoCal)Location: Can be in LA or Orange County
Cordial is next-generation email platform built on real-time data. We solve the problems that legacy ESP’s create for marketers by simplifying data management and empowering brands to create rich personalized experiences across email and mobile. Founded in 2013 by some of the brightest minds in marketing, Cordial has significant funding from investors like Upfront Ventures and High Alpha. Cordial is helping companies like La Quinta, Teleflora, and Revolve Clothing change how they communicate with their customers. We’ve also been featured as one of San Diego’s best places to work by DMN. We’re looking for other passionate, collaborative, opinionated people to join our burgeoning team!. We believe in hard work and uncapped earning potential in a high-growth environment. We’re expanding our sales machine in the Western US, the candidate will be located in Los Angeles or Orange County.

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FORCordial is looking for a savvy, well connected Enterprise sales professional with deep experience in the email marketing, ecommerce platform or mobile messaging to expand our growth in the West. The perfect candidate will have been a repeated top performer in their region, be an excellent communicator both written and verbal (yes... words matter….), have sold technical products, run their own demos and have been successful in previous roles breaking into a territory with limited brand exposure. If you are ready to disrupt a legacy industry, compete head to head with enterprise cloud platforms and be part of next generation innovations in email, mobile and connected products, you should reach out. We have a deep pedigree in Enterprise email, data management and CRM technology, but early enough for this role to have a big impact on our growth.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Identify and quantify customer needs and opportunities (Enterprise targets)
  • Exceed quarterly and annual revenue targets with consultative sales or challenger sales approach
  • Develop a territory, develop 5x quota in pipeline with viable opportunities, and be able to forecast accurately
  • Strategically within and across marketing, IT and leadership functions within the target accounts

    • REQUIREMENTS
  • 5-10 years complex Saas/ software sales experience running deals as quarterback
  • Prior Enterprise sales experience in email, ecommerce or mobile required
  • Working in a fast-paced growing company environment where self-starters can excel
  • Excellent sales, lead development, qualification and presentation skills
  • Stable record with 2+ years in each organization or upward growth within the same
  • BA/BS or equivalent

    • CORDIAL BENEFITS:
  • Stock options for all employees
  • Paid Holidays, Sick leave and Self-Managed Vacation policy (we don’t cap time off)
  • Gym membership reimbursement
  • Dedicated “learning” budget for expanding skills/expertise
  • Medical, Dental/Vision, FSA plans

items.title: VP of Employer Sales
items.content:
VP of Employer Sales at Carrum Health

San Francisco, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Sales, Sales Strategy and Management, Customer Acquisition, Healthcare Expertise, Sales and Marketing, Enterprise Sales, Sales/Marketing and Strategic Partnerships, Employee Benefits
Compensation
$150K–$225K
0.1%–1.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

At Carrum, we live and breathe our mission of transforming our healthcare system to create an unmatched experience for patients. If you are passionate about making a positive impact on the evolution of the healthcare industry and thrive in an entrepreneurial, cutting-edge environment, we would love to talk to you. You will be responsible for leading Carrum Health’s self-insured employer sales function by driving rapid client growth and revenue-generating opportunities. This leadership role will build a winning go-to-market strategy for acquiring employer clients through direct and distribution partner (e.g., broker and benefit consultant) channels. You will source demand for Carrum’s product, cultivate relationships with employers and channel partners, close deals and take full ownership of sales targets and results.

Your Impact:
Design and execute Carrum’s go-to-market strategy to drive revenue opportunities
Autonomously identify, engage, scope, and execute sales opportunities with sophisticated buyers
Lead the sales process including phone/web/in-person meetings, follow-through, contracting, and transition to implementation teams
Institutionalize best practices and process improvements to decrease sales cycle time and cost to acquire new clients
Establish mechanisms to effectively manage and report on the sales pipeline
Collaborate with the CEO to reflect the company’s vision for growth and
expansion into an actionable sales plan
Provide substantial strategic leadership and guidance within the company
Coordinate cross-functionally to ensure effective messaging of Carrum’s value
proposition, product features and partnership expectations to new clients
Drive Carrum’s market expansion by continuously recruiting and developing top
sales talent
Enjoy getting your hands dirty

You Will Be Successful If You Have:
8+ years sales experience with 3+ years in a management or formal leadership
role at VP or Director level
Extensive experience selling into large employer groups (5000+ employees),
either directly or through channel partners (e.g., brokers and benefit consultants)
Impeccable customer focus and professionalism. Proactively asserts, clarifies and
validates client needs on an ongoing basis
Demonstrated ability in developing and successfully implementing sales and
marketing strategy (e.g., customer segmentation, sales process and organization
design, performance management and sales incentives)
Expertise in all aspects of the sales process including: performing initial outreach,
developing relationships, negotiating and closing contracts, and managing
ongoing relationships
Outstanding communication, presentation, negotiation and relationship-building
skills; able to engage with all levels of an organization
Bachelor’s Degree in business or related field

You Will Excel If You Have:
Experience selling health IT, medical insurance, enterprise benefits, SaaS or
consulting solutions into the self-insured employer market targeting CFO, HR or
Benefits professionals
Highly motivated, high-energy, must-win approach
Entrepreneurial vigor – you bring structure to undefined problems, identify
sources of value in complex environments, and convey those to diverse
stakeholders in a simple and compelling way
Deep knowledge of healthcare benefits, the healthcare industry, and the
employee benefits space; background in a Health Plan, Benefits Consulting or
Management Consulting is a plus
Experience successfully recruiting, developing and managing sales teams

What We Offer:
Competitive salary
Stock options
Open, collaborative workspace at our waterside office in South San Francisco
Flexible vacation policy
Medical insurance, 401K, free lunches and one day per week to work from home

items.title: Director, Demand Generation @ LogicMonitor
items.content:
Director, Demand Generation @ LogicMonitor

2018-01-24 04:03

Description

About Us:

LogicMonitor is the leading SaaS based performance monitoring platform for enterprise IT.

We love going to work and think you should too. We hold our company culture near and dear – it represents an intermix between passion for rock star work output and passion for an active, healthy life centered around family and friends. LogicMonitor represents community, collaboration and camaraderie.

This is a remote-based position where you may work from a local or home-based office.

What You'll Do:

Ready to ride a rocketship? LogicMonitor, the leading enterprise hybrid monitoring solution, seeks a seasoned demand generation expert to help fuel our growth as we blast into the enterprise space.

This key leadership role will develop and execute a variety of integrated marketing programs including always on campaigns, new new logo acquisition programs, installed base expansion programs and campaigns to grow our managed service provider business.

The successful candidate will have experience growing, nurturing and mentoring high performing managers and individual contributors, working cross functionally, pushing creative boundaries and building strong relationships.

Demonstrated success growing pipeline across segments and creating new revenue streams for a SaaS business is critical.

Responsibilities:

  • Own the orchestration of our drip nurture programs leveraging Marketo and Salesforce.
  • Manage our SEM and SEO efforts, constantly optimizing spend and analyzing results.
  • Drive the creation of high quality, externally facing integrated campaigns and go-to-market programs.
  • Work with sales to inspire, motivate and ultimately win flagship brands.
  • Track, measure and report against objectives.
  • Create assets and offers that nurture prospects and customers throughout the sales cycle.
  • Create, execute, measure and optimize quarterly demand generation plans.

Desired Skills and Experience:

  • 12+ years of experience in enterprise software with a deep understanding of technology
  • 12+ years of experience in demand generation through integrated campaigns
  • Must be high energy, passionate, innovative and creative
  • A dynamic, confident personality with the ability to successfully drive projects with minimal guidance
  • Proven creative thinker that can generate and execute on innovative "breakout" marketing ideas for integrated campaigns.
  • Proven track record in working successfully in a fast pace environment to effectively manage multiple projects.
  • BA required, MBA preferred

Bonus skills:

  • Expertise with Marketo, Salesforce, Powerpoint and/or Apple Keynote are huge
  • 5+ years people management skills

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Bilingual Training Executive, German
items.content:
Who we are

Altus Analytics, a business of Altus Group, is the leading global technology partner to the commercial real estate industry and is poised for significant growth and expansion over the next three years.

Altus Analytics brings together the collective expertise of ARGUS and Voyanta as the leading provider of CRE solutions worldwide. Our technology and industry expertise empowers commercial real estate clients and partners to work collaboratively to enhance decision making, drive performance and optimize transactional efficiency. From property budgeting, making strategic decisions about acquisitions or working with different teams, different organisations and different data, we can bring it all together.

The opportunity

As we focus on expanding adoption of and engagement with our ARGUS AE product across Europe, we need a new Bilingual Training Executive to join our London office. As a member of the Education team, you’ll be instructing our clients in virtual and classroom settings across the world.

Who you are

You are a Trainer and in-class Facilitator looking to move into the fast-paced software training world; or, you have software training experience and, you recognize the potential, excitement and opportunities at Altus Analytics. We are disrupting the #PropTech sector and joining us now is a chance to work for a market leader who is responsive to client needs, on the cutting edge of tech and supports the £10 trillion CRE industry.

What’s in it for you

Impact. This is a newly created role and an opportunity for someone who has been there-done that to take on the rewards of driving client growth and engagement through education.

Career development. The experience and exposure gained as our new Training Executive, EMEA is a significant boost on a career path as you learn our product from all angles, leading to possibilities in sales, product management, consulting or other areas that fit your interests and skill set.

Here’s just a glimpse at what you will be doing:
• Facilitating in-classroom training at training facilities and client sites across EMEA.
• Continuously changing your training methods during sessions to maintain attention.
• Creating custom training plans based on available technology - one size doesn’t fit all.
• Talking to clients, answering their questions and helping them understand our products.
• Working with universities to expand ARGUS’ certification program.

So, how do we know that’s you? You have:
• The expertise. You have proven experience in corporate adult education and training.
• The education and the interest. You have a university degree and expertise in MS Office.
• The passion for math and technology. You are able to explain complicated financial concepts, new terminology and technical processes to a variety of audiences. You learn new software, tools and concepts easily.
• The flexibility. You have a valid passport and driver’s license. You are able and willing to travel up to 70% through the EMEA region.
• The language. You are fluently bilingual in English and German.
• The relationship building skills. You can easily make and nurture connections with your teammates and your clients.

Need any more reasons to want to work with us?

As we continue to grow, the possibilities for the people that join Altus are significant. From professional growth to innovation to collaboration we are committed to continuing to foster the right environment to help our people realize their full potential. We give our people the freedom and responsibility to take charge of their career path, bring new ideas to the forefront and work on critical projects that will shape the success of our clients.

We thank you in advance for taking the time to learn more about what makes Altus a great place to grow your career and do some of your best work. Apply now, refer a friend or stay on top of what’s new by following us on LinkedIn.

items.title: Head of People Operations
items.content:
Status

Status is building powerful decentralized apps on Ethereum that change the way we do things on the web. Our rapidly growing team is made up of self-motivated individuals who prosper in a fast-paced environment and value the ability to work from anywhere.As a product, Status is an open source discovery tool for the Ethereum blockchain that makes it easy for anyone to access apps and services built on the decentralized web. Status also allows users to browse, chat, make payments and more.

Opportunity

Although still in its infancy, blockchain technology is developing rapidly and is poised to have a profound impact on our social, financial and legal systems. By joining us, you’ll help to craft the way people interact with these technologies.

Job role

We are looking for a Head of People Operations to support the company scale. The role will focus on developing the culture and processes while managing all benefits and HR initiatives in our distributed team.

Responsibilities

  • Development of our internal performance management, including compensation structure/normalization, promotion process, performance reviews, handling poor performance, etc.
  • Improvement and nurture of our Company Culture, scaling and optimizing the company culture while in a distributed team
  • Managing the onboarding, namely scalable onboarding for a distributed team
  • Identifying and proposing company benefits

Requirements

  • Compulsory 3+ years working experience in a remote team
  • Hands-on experience scaling remote teams preferably in a high-growth start-up environment
  • Experience implementing HR Performance, compensation and promotion processes remotely
  • Experience developing innovative approaches to improve organizational culture.
  • Trustworthy with attention to detail
  • Excellent active listening skills, clear communication style, and high intercultural awareness

Working at Status

We're a remote team of made up of 55 people scattered around the globe. Everyone at Status works from a location of their choosing - and we all meet up twice a year to strategize and strengthen our relationships.

We care deeply about open source software, and our organizational structure does away with a strict hierarchy and fixed work hours. We believe in working with a high degree of autonomy while supporting the team's priorities.

items.title: Head of Digital Marketing
items.content:
This role is a unique opportunity to transform lives by spearheading our digital marketing to bring psychotherapy to a worldwide audience. The role requires leadership and vision to drive our digital strategy, but also hands-on delivery of all our campaigns to maximise the take up and effectiveness of our marketplace.

Our vision is to put a positive spin on accessing quality help. It’s our belief that everyone can benefit from professional support - not only individuals with complex psychological conditions but people wishing to maximise their fulfilment in life.

We are looking for a proficient marketer-designer to create and execute digital marketing strategies to promote our ground-breaking work.

The role requires the ability to convert business objectives into marketing initiatives that are clear, attractive and deliver our conversion goals.

In addition to creating the overarching strategy, the role is responsible for all design, production and upgrading of print and digital assets.

Specific responsibilities will include:

• creating and optimising AdWords campaigns with a target on conversion
• delivering SEO optimisation to drive customer acquisition on both Harley Therapy websites
• producing landing pages and adverts for social media - Facebook, Instagram, Twitter etc.
• creating and producing video content for digital campaign usage

ABOUT YOU:

• you have experience in building a complete digital marketing channel.
• you can demonstrate a track record achieving results through digital campaigns across a range of media
• you are obsessed with using data to drive and inform decisions with specific experience in using Analytics tools to track and manage campaign effectiveness.
• you have great copywriting skills and impeccable attention to detail
• you are competent with simple CSS and HTML and have experience with content management systems (we use WordPress and MODx).
• you have demonstrated ability to optimise digital campaigns across different devices &amp; screens.
• you have prior experience in an agency or in-house team
• you have a growth mindset - failures are a springboard to improvement
• you are self-motivated and self-directed with a keen eye for detail
• you work swiftly and smartly.
• you love to learn and thrive on challenges.

If you also have experience on Sketch &amp; Canvas and can use SQL you will be at an advantage.

BENEFITS:

Be involved with the growth of this exciting, social impact initiative at its early stage as a chief marketer. We are a small, supportive, tight-knit team passionate about improving people’s emotional wellbeing.

• Work remotely anywhere you like.
• Work part-time around your commitments with scope for full-time hours
• Invitation to two social events a year

Additional Information

'A small team of A+ players can run circles around a giant team of B and C players.' Steve jobs

We work remotely though assemble for in-person team meetings several times a year. We are looking for a UK candidate who can travel to central London when needed.

We are an internally funded and stable startup umbrella organisation - not dependent on VC (though we use resources conservatively!)

If you would like to be a part of this exciting movement and meet the criteria above, please submit your CV and a covering note with examples of your work/portfolio.


Closing date: We will close the post once the role is suitably filled.

No agencies please.

Only successful applicants will be contacted - within 2 weeks of applying.
