items.title: VP of Operations @ Kindly Care
items.content:
VP of Operations @ Kindly Care

2018-01-08 03:30

Description

About Us:

Kindly Care helps families find, hire, and manage private caregivers so that their elderly loved ones can age in their homes rather having to move into assisted living facilities. We take pride in the fact that we’re working on one of the most pressing problems in our society: ensuring that our seniors are taken care of despite seemingly endless challenges caused by fiscal and labor shortages.

We’re a geographically distributed company, with 4 team members working out of our office in San Francisco and about 40 others working from all over the US, Canada, Mexico and a number of other countries. We have built all products and processes to equally accommodate on-site and remote team members, and we highly value this ability to attract the best talent from across the world.

About This Role:

We’re looking for a VP of Operations to ensure flawless execution of all of our teams. You will be reporting to our CEO, and your success will be measured in the quality of our service and our ability to scale our processes. Your scope of work will cover the conceptual design of our process maps, budget planning, as well as management of our client- and caregiver-facing operational departments. Specifically, your direct reports will include team leads from these areas:

  • Talent Operations – responsible for sourcing, vetting, and retention of our caregivers
  • Client Operations – following up on all client requests
  • Support – resolving all tickets filed by our clients and caregivers
  • Accounting – assistance with timesheets and billing

While you don’t have to be an expert in any of the above areas, you will have to get comfortable with the subject matter in order to create efficiencies across all those teams.

Due to the high volume of inbound and outbound calls across all of our departments, special consideration will be given to the candidate who has experience in call center operations. Specifically, we’d like to hear about your experience with various telephony software solutions, task workflows, ticketing systems, quality assurance processes, and general training best practices.

About You:

The ideal candidate will have already proven their ability to grow and manage operational teams, although we will consider all applicants who can demonstrate extraordinary achievement in their careers. We value relevant experience, but we are equally intrigued by generalists who are able to take a first-principles approach and come up with creative solutions. Below are the general qualifications we’re looking for:

  • 5+ years of experience in building and scaling teams
  • Thorough understanding of call center best practices
  • Proven ability to resolve conflicts and win over clients
  • Exposure to entrepreneurial environments and startup mentality
  • Familiarity with process mapping tools and best practices

Last but not least, you need to have the leadership skills that will help you motivate your teams and energize them to do the best work of their lives.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: TaxJar: Head of Partnerships
items.content:
Head of Partnerships

Posted Jan 6

TaxJar
Headquarters: Boston, MA
www.taxjar.com/jobs

TaxJar has an immediate opening for an enthusiastic, experienced, and driven Head of Partnerships to help small and medium sized eCommerce businesses save time and money on sales tax compliance.

This is a full-time remote position, available to folks located in the continental US only.

About TaxJar

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 10,000 businesses. We were founded to help eCommerce owners spend less time on sales tax and more time growing the businesses they love. We’re passionate about creating simple solutions and leveraging technology to solve complicated sales tax issues. We're not just about sales tax though, we're a technology-driven company focused on providing a great experience for both merchants and developers.

We offer TaxJar Reports , a simple web-based reporting tool that organizes sales tax data into return-ready reports by state; AutoFile, a service that automatically files sales tax returns; and SmartCalcs API, a modern, accurate, sales tax API for developers to outsource sales tax rates and calculations. For developers, we have created an helpful API demo environment and also are fanatics about creating and maintaining great API documentation.

We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

About TaxJar’s Growth Team:

The mission of TaxJar’s growth team consists of sales, marketing, content, and partnerships, and our mission in is clear: get more eCommerce businesses in the US to experience using TaxJar for managing their sales tax reporting, filing and calculations, and to help show those businesses the tremendous value in cost and time-savings in choosing to fully automate their sales tax needs.

The team’s goal is to maximize the number of qualified customers that begin our free trial and ensure the highest percentage of those folks end up as a customers on the other side. Our team is small, but we have a huge impact on the business. We work very closely with  the customer success and product development teams in order to deliver on these goals.

We are looking to expand the team with a talented and experienced Head of Partnership that fully understands how to own and grow the relationships with our partners.

Areas of focus for this role will be

1. Working with our existing eCommerce and channel partners to increase TaxJar’s exposure in their ecosystems, and develop plans to create mutual success. These partnerships include eCommerce carts, marketplaces, and key influencers of these channels.

2. Establish and grow a program to work with the eCommerce channel partners, including systems integrators and digital agencies who build, deploy and maintain eCommerce sites for merchants, and develop a process to measure success of the channel.

3. Own the strategy for future partnerships and TaxJar integrations, and execute on a partner roadmap. This will also include building our in-house and third party integrations strategy, developing our affiliate program, and building plans to work with CPAs and tax professionals.

4. Build a partnerships team. This role will begin as a very hands-on execution role with no direct reports, but expect that a successful team member will develop the processes including establishment of KPIs and dashboards, reporting, and ultimately build out a partnerships team based on his or her recommended growth plan, and primarily funded through revenue growth generated through partnerships.

10 things About You…

  1. You have a track record of building strong relationships. You’ve been able to build a large partner & channel marketing base in previous roles of customers and partners that know and trust you. You’ve demonstrated results delivering on partner KPIs in the past.
  2. You can see the full-picture. You’re thoughtful and organized. Before beginning a project, you take the time to understand both “why we’re doing this” and “why it makes sense to do this now”.
  3. You’re a pro at communicating. When working with the team and externally with customers, you’re a pro at both communicating clearly and listening to feedback. You have excellent visual and verbal communication skills. You’re a great writer who can effectively and creatively communicate TaxJar’s value to businesses across a variety of formats and platforms.
  4. You’re a self-starter with an entrepreneurial mindset, able to build and execute a plan with imperfect data. You’re resourceful and scrappy and able to leverage content and tools to get programs started quickly. You have an understanding of complete go-to-market planning and execution.
  5. You have a strong work ethic with the ability to prioritize, you meet deadlines and requirements of internal and external customers by responding promptly and thoroughly with all types of requests.
  6. You’re an excellent project manager who can be counted on to deliver quality results for multiple projects to completion on a deadline.
  7. You’re a team player, and a team builder. You step in to help when others need you and your job is to make “all boats rise” on our team. You’re also fully open to giving and receiving thoughtful, constructive straightforward feedback as you learn and grow. You have experience in building out a high performing team.
  8. You understand the role of education in the sales process. You’ve had experience designing and implementing programs and scaleable trainings to help educate channel partners on your product’s value and purpose.
  9. You’ve closely partnered with sales or have worked in a sales environment in previous roles. You’re able to provide consultative sales support and training/demonstrations for partners and customers.
  10. You’ve managed and grown a partner program from the ground up and have shown the ability to initiate processes, effectively manage partners, build materials and structure a program build strong relationships and drive additional leads.

If that sounds like you, here’s what we need you to help with:

  • Develop and maintain multi-level relationships with key partner brands, customers, and influencers. Collaborate with partners to identify and creative high-value co-marketing opportunities.

  • Build a playbook to launch and grow the channel marketing program, and then execute on it.

  • Take ownership of the TaxJar affiliate program. Create opportunities and incentives for new partners to join our channel and affiliate programs.

  • Build a plan to expand TaxJar’s data integration partners, including additional eCommerce and ERP integrations, and considering internally build and third party integrations

  • Develop a plan for building a channel of CPAs and Tax Professionals, and work closely with product development to build the features they need in TaxJar.

  • Work closely with marketing to define and craft messaging, positioning, and core marketing collateral for programs.

  • Proactively drive all internal and partner communications for channel programs, including sharing of best practices and case studies to drive further buy-in and adoption of TaxJar across channels.

  • Manage demand generation programs like webinars, blogs, white papers, etc. for partners and work closely with growth team to optimize effectiveness of campaigns.

  • Develop and execute sales tax education programs for the TaxJar partner community.

  • Follow channel programs through to completion by working closely with sales to qualify leads. and completing post-program ROI analysis. Always be willing to dive into our data and help the team understand how we’re doing and where we can improve.

  • Willingness to travel and attend in-person trade shows and live events with customers and communicate with partners through various channels including social media, slack, etc

Preferred Qualifications

  • 5+ years with partnerships experience in the tech space, preferably in marketing SaaS technologies to eCommerce audiences
  • 2+ years of leading a team or managing people

  • Strong, existing relationships in eCommerce is a big plus

Apply for this position

Apply here: https://taxjar.workable.com/jobs/636571

items.title: Lean Startup Co: Executive Producer
items.content:
Executive Producer

Posted Jan 6

Lean Startup Co
Headquarters: United States
https://lean-startup-co.breezy.hr/p/2a753223c89d01-executive-producer?source=weworkremotely

ABOUT US:
Born from the global movement spawned by Eric Ries’ book, The Lean Startup, Lean Startup Company offers the most exciting education solutions in modern management available today. We bring the entrepreneurial spirit to all types of organizations and help them transform how they work. Our education efforts, media and live events serve every size company and sector of the economy - from the the aspiring entrepreneur to high-growth startups, nonprofits, and large bureaucratic institutions.

A cutting-edge methodology, Lean Startup principles provide a scientific approach to problem-solving and a framework for innovation, so you can learn what your customers really want. It’s about testing your vision continuously, so you can effectively adapt and adjust before it’s too late.

ABOUT THE POSITION

Our annual Lean Startup Conference brings the big ideas from Eric Ries’s books off the page to show how organizations are making them real around the world. Alongside keynotes and case studies, we offer workshops for an immersive experience, breaking off a chunk of practice and working through it with seasoned experts. We bring the world’s brightest minds in entrepreneurial management together with entrepreneurs and corporate innovators, in one place, to share challenges, inspiration and and learning.

As the Lean Startup movement grows, there’s a growing need to connect those who want to learn with those who want to help them move towards working the Startup Way.

And Lean Startup Co is the answer.

As the seasoned full-time Executive Producer for Lean Startup Co, you’ll lead and design the aforementioned flagship conference. You’ll connect entrepreneurs and corporate innovators with inspiring Lean Startup experts. You’ll design an unforgettable experience that’ll have them signing up year after year.

You’re our ideal candidate if you’re excited to practice what we preach and help us identify how we can reach more people, make more impact and solve the world’s biggest problems.


As our in-house Executive Producer you will own and drive the following major initiatives:

  • Annual flagship conference (executive producer)
  • International partner summits (strategy and advisory)

You’ll thrive in this role if you have a high level of success in these five areas of core competency:

  1. Track record of complete ownership of all aspects of major event production
  2. Proven ability to oversee concept, design, operations, finance, editorial, marketing, media, coordination of production and technical aspects, and directing of staff (venues, clients, vendors, technicians, internal team, etc.)
  • Track record of creativity and innovation in major event production
    • You’ve created a program and experience for a 1,000+ person conference that attracts new attendees, addresses emerging trends, and features high-quality speakers and industry experts.
    • Although you can demonstrate that you always nail both the quantitative and technical aspects, you also pride yourself on your ability to impress attendees with the visual aspects of an event.
  • Track record of leading and managing a successful event team
    • You have significant experience with and enjoy recruiting, hiring and developing a high performing team
  • Demonstration of business acumen and financially savvy
    • Not only are you an event extraordinaire, but you are also financially savvy. You set and manage realistic budgets, utilize a PO system and believe in and practice financial stewardship.
    • You understand the importance of metrics, leading indicators and how to tie ticket sales, sponsorship goals, and your team’s performance to achieve revenue goals.
  • Data-Driven Marketing
    • You have a marketing mindset and love using data to make smart decisions and achieve desired outcomes.

    As the Executive Producer, you will champion addressing the needs of our community through:

    • Managing and overseeing all event production, including live 2,000+-person Annual Flagship Conference (next scheduled conference is Fall 2018).
    • Produce all events from conception to execution, with livestream.
    • Oversee strategy to support the success of international summit partner events.
  • Managing and overseeing a marketing team to
    • Ensure our global community of entrepreneurs understands the value proposition of our live experiences by leveraging editorial content.
    • Conduct customer development, analyze past conference data and trends, run experiments, and set milestones and outcomes.
    • Leverage relevant tools to promote events such as social channels, digital marketing plan and logistics, event website, AMAs, webcasts, blogs, etc.

    You’ll fit right into this role and our team if:

    • You thrive in a fast-paced environment where we love challenging ourselves (in Lean Startup fashion) to build, measure, and learn.
    • You LOVE solving problems and aren’t afraid to admit you are obsessed with getting the details right.
    • You believe in and practice financial stewardship and have a deep understanding of the business side of production.
    • You believe in the importance of aligning your work with company goals, and the integrity of the brand.
    • You possess high levels of integrity, autonomy, and self-motivation.
    • You are a natural leader and have a track record of developing and mentoring teams:
    • You are assertive, fair, and capable of directing others and implementing projects with little to no supervision.
    • You have a keen ability to set priorities across functions, to lead and work well with cross-functional teams.
    • You have a positive leadership style, hold yourself accountable for your actions, encourage the team to learn from mistakes, and recognize your team for their efforts.
    • You have experience with and enjoy managing a remote team and leading team onsites.

    Requirements:

    • BA/BS in Marketing or Business preferred
    • 5-8+ years of experience leading creative and production teams
    • 5+ years in managing Corporate Events or Tech events
    • Executive level communication, interpersonal and delegation skills.
    • Must have experience with and enjoy recruiting, hiring and developing a high performing team.
    • Must have ability to juggle and prioritize many different tasks simultaneously, and enjoy collaborating with a wide range of teams.
    • Familiarity with and enjoy working collaboratively (Slack, Zoom, Google apps).
    • Experience working with union regulations.
    • Bonus if you have experience in Lean Startup, tech and innovation space.

    Why You’ll Love Working With Us

    • We encourage growth.
    • You’ll have your very own Lean Startup coach to support practicing Lean Startup methods in achieving event outcomes (i.e., A/B testing, leading indicators, actionable metrics, etc.)
  • You can work from wherever you want, as long as you have a working laptop and solid internet connection.
    • We’re a 100% remote team using fun collaborative tools.
    • We encourage unplugging and prefer you don’t check email while you’re away.
  • Big impact.
    • If you’ve ever wanted to be in the middle of it all and leave a legacy, this is it. The work we do will go down in history as powerfully-transformative.
    • We are a startup with global brand recognition headquartered in San Francisco, CA. Our global community will give you a front row seat to the challenges they’re facing around innovation. Better yet, you get to help them solve their problems.

    The position is full-time remote, but we ask that you’re 1) located in the U.S. and 2) available to communicate during Pacific Time business hours.

    Compensation: Base DOE + participation in the financial success of your events
    *Note - We understand that you are eager to hear back from us. We receive a lot of applications and cannot respond to all of them. Please do not reach out to us regarding your application. If there is a mutual fit, we will contact you to move forward with the next steps in the process.

    Apply for this position

    https://lean-startup-co.breezy.hr/p/2a753223c89d01-executive-producer?source=weworkremotely

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior, Manager
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Big Data
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

About the Job:We are seeking a Project Manager to join our Professional Services team.  Our Enterprise business is growing and as Project Manager you will be responsible for leading one or more teams in delivering end-to-end Projects and Solutions to our existing and new customers.As People Manager you will lead and motivate a team of Software Developers.  

Responsibilities:

    • Successful execution and management of customer projects
    • People management and team leadership to Software Engineers
    • Work collaboratively with Development, Product, QA and Sales teams to ensure we provide the best solutions to our customers
    • Work closely with our Sales and Customer Success Teams for ongoing Services management post launch
About You:Focus on customer and service delivery metricsDeliver and manage high-quality projects to our customersComfortable  working within a collaborative start-up cultureA natural leader who takes initiative and gets things done

Required Skills:

    • 4+ years of technical project management experience, coupled with People Management responsibility
    • Strong working knowledge of Project Management  methodologies,  Agile desirable
    • An excellent communicator with demonstrated influencing and negotiating skills
    • Natural ability to work independently and without boundaries
    • Flexibility to meet work demands within international time zones
    • Disciplined in planning and execution to achieve goals
    • Customer and commercial awareness  

About Scrapinghub

Founded in 2010, Scrapinghub is a fast growing and diverse technology business turning web content into useful data with a cloud-based web crawling platform, off-the-shelf datasets, and turn-key web scraping services.

We’re a globally distributed team of over 100 Scrapinghubbers working from over 30 countries who are passionate about scraping, web crawling, and data science.

As a new Scrapinghubber, you will:

Become part of a self-motivated, progressive, multi-cultural team.

Autonomy to make the role your own, supported by great people

Join a team with huge opportunity to make a difference

Have the freedom to work from wherever you want.

Have the opportunity to go to conferences and meet with the team from across the globe.

Get the chance to work with cutting-edge open source technologies and tools.

Benefits

Flexible working hours
Remote working
Paid time off
Paid open source work
Global team meet ups

items.title: Head of Marketing
items.content:
Head of Marketing
Remote // Full Time

Join one of the largest and fastest growing yoga and fitness platforms on the web.

DOYOUYOGA is looking for an experienced project lead with a marketing or operations background to join our fun and ambitious team from around the world.

About DOYOUYOGA

DOYOUYOGA is a young and rapidly growing brand serving millions of lifestyle­ conscious consumers worldwide. With over 400,000 members and millions of workouts logged, DYY is one of the most recognized brands in its space. But this is just the beginning...

About the position

We’re a small but ambitious team that’s ready to take on the world. And that’s where you come into play. We’re looking for an experienced doer. Somebody who’s not afraid to get her/his hands dirty and work across various disciplines to achieve great things together with a passionate team. Our new Head of Marketing will lead our content creation, social media, and onsite marketing efforts. She/he will furthermore manage team operations and spearhead a variety of existing and new projects.

The truth is, we’re not looking for a specific candidate. This role will inevitably be tailored to the individual who applies and joins. Regardless of how well you feel you fit our description, we encourage you to apply if you love leading digital projects, working with and leading remote teams, and building a brand that millions love.

Requirements

  • You have proven, senior expertise (3+ years) in one or more of the following: Digital marketing, digital project management, operations;
  • You’ve managed interdisciplinary teams and you’re very comfortable doing it;
  • You’re a goal-oriented, creative leader who thinks outside the box to reach our strategic goals;
  • You’re self-confident, modest, and have the ability to receive and give constructive feedback;
  • You have outstanding communication and interpersonal skills;
  • You’re based in Europe or Asia (American and Australian time zones do not work. This is a strict requirement.);
  • You have a passion for healthy and active living (no yoga knowledge required);
  • Heads up “digital nomads”: We’re a remote team, so you can work from anywhere. However, we do not hire “digital nomads” who spend most of their time traveling. We’re working on achieving great things, so do not apply if you don’t have a permanent place to stay or change your location every couple of weeks.

    What you get

  • Challenging and rewarding projects with fast decision making, flat hierarchies, and quick results that impact millions of users;
  • Fun and ambitious colleagues that will support, challenge, and inspire you;
  • Work remotely with flexible hours;
  • 24 vacation days per year;
  • Competitive salary package (incl. profit sharing plan);
  • Long-term contract. We want you to stay with us!
  • If you are based in Hong Kong, you will be hired as a regular employee. If you are not based in Hong Kong, you will be hired as a full time contractor. Either way, all benefits listed here are the same.

    Important: Please tell us your permanent location (City and Country).

    Sounds good? Then apply :-)

items.content:
Kindly Care | San Francisco | VP of Operations | REMOTE | https://www.kindlycare.com

Kindly Care helps families find, hire, and manage private caregivers so that their elderly loved ones can age in their homes rather having to move into assisted living facilities. We take pride in the fact that we’re working on one of the most pressing problems in our society: ensuring that our seniors are taken care of despite seemingly endless challenges caused by fiscal and labor shortages.

We’re a geographically distributed company, with 4 team members working out of our office in San Francisco and about 40 others working from all over the US, Canada, Mexico and a number of other countries. We have built all products and processes to equally accommodate on-site and remote team members, and we highly value this ability to attract the best talent from across the world.

We’re looking for a VP of Operations to ensure flawless execution of all of our teams. You will be reporting to our CEO, and your success will be measured in the quality of our service and our ability to scale our processes. Your scope of work will cover the conceptual design of our process maps, budget planning, as well as management of our client- and caregiver-facing operational departments.

More info: https://www.kindlycare.com/vp-operations/

Let's chat! I am Igor and you can reach me at hr@kindlycare.com.

items.title: Director Engineering
items.content:
Director, Engineering


Location: Flexible (Boston preferred)


Position is available: Immediately


THE OPPORTUNITY


Reporting to the Vice President, Technology, the Director, Engineering is responsible for managing members of the Engineering Team who create the software products and tools that best support our mission. They will partner closely with various internal teams while managing the team responsible for building the capabilities and features for a web application (myANet) that provides access to data reports and instructional materials that teachers and school leaders use to help shape excellent instruction for students. The Director, Engineering  will oversee the development of our software solutions, creating the capabilities and enhancements that are needed to support our work by leveraging a combination of custom software applications and integration of 3rd party services into our technical platform.  


ANet is flexible to remote working with appropriate experience and a history of successfully mentoring other developers remotely. Occasional travel to ANet’s National Office in Boston will be necessary, so proximity to the New England area and eastern time zone is preferable.


WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Build, develop, and retain a high-performing and highly engaged team of engineers

  • Lead the development of our software applications and tools

  • Manage software deployments (DevOps), manage our AWS environment

  • Represent Engineering in strategic product discussions, helping to scope solutions to meet both timing needs as well as business requirements

  • Build relationships and collaborate with cross-functional peers, ensuring strong communication and coordination

  • Work with the Vice President of Technology to manage our Engineering budget, allocate resources, and to ensure the team is delivering high quality products on-time and within budget

  • Improve our technical infrastructure; Obsesses about technical debt

  • Work with VP, Product Management on overall software development processes

  • Lead the team in executing the development sprints

  • Champion ANet’s core values


WHO YOU ARE AND WHAT YOU BRING


In order to be successful in this role, candidates must demonstrate the following:



  • You have a track record of building and managing successful Agile engineering teams and are energized by developing and coaching others to do their best work

  • You have direct experience in a combination of the following:




    • Scrum or other Agile development processes

    • Cloud-based infrastructure on AWS, including continuous integration and deployment

    • RESTful Web Services

    • Cloud-based data services, preferably with both SQL and NoSQL

    • Java, Angular, and/or Go programming language


  • You know what it takes to develop and release large, high-quality software applications and have demonstrated exceptional judgment regarding resource tradeoffs

  • You are adept at project and time management, with experience leading long-term projects alongside changing priorities in both project and product requirements



  • You are an exceptional communicator, both written and verbal, and are skilled in communicating with audiences that have varying levels of technical expertise

  • You believe in ANet’s mission and share our passion for increasing opportunities for children in underserved communities while operating with a sense of urgency in the support of schools

  • You are committed to living out ANet’s Core Values daily and are open to examining personal archetypes and bias while discussing topics related to race, class, and privilege, all of which relate to our Advance Equity and People Matter values.


Ideal candidates may also demonstrate the following preferred qualifications:



  • You have prior software development experience in an education, EdTech, and/or nonprofit setting

  • You bring exposure to building products or services for the education market, ideally for teachers

  • You have a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Math, Engineering or related degree

  • For candidates interested in working remotely, you bring demonstrated experience and previous success working remotely



WHAT WE OFFER


ANet offers highly competitive compensation based on prior experience and qualifications as well as comprehensive benefits in order to best support our people. Benefits we offer include: health, dental and vision insurance where ANet pays 80% of the cost of these benefits for employees and their families/domestic partner; 3 weeks of vacation (4 weeks after two years with ANet); 10 paid holidays with paid days off between the Christmas and New Year’s holidays; a paid floating holiday; paid sick & personal days; paid parental leave; retirement plan options; commuter benefits; tuition reimbursement;  flexible spending accounts; short and long-term disability coverage; and basic life and personal accident insurance.


HOW TO APPLY


We are accepting applications for this position immediately.  To apply, please visit our Job Board (http://www.achievementnetwork.org/careers/). After clicking on the title associated with this role, you will be prompted to create an application and upload a resume and thoughtful cover letter. In your cover letter, please outline why you are interested in working for ANet and how your skills and experience meet the qualifications of the position. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling and urgent basis.


ANet is committed to maximizing the diversity of our organization. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage individuals of all ethnic and racial backgrounds and gender identities to apply to our positions.

items.title: Origin (https://www.originprotocol.com) is a blockchain project focused on building the sharing economy without intermediaries. We're creating ...
items.content:
Origin (https://www.originprotocol.com) is a blockchain project focused on building the sharing economy without intermediaries. We're creating protocols to allow buyers and sellers of fractional usage assets and services (think Airbnb, Getaround, Fiverr, Taskrabbit) to transact without paying middlemen 20-30%. We're excited by the opportunity to build censorship resistant marketplaces and redistribute value to the contributors to the network instead of just the founders and VCs. We believe the open source protocols we're developing could ultimately replace dozens of existing multimillion or multibillion dollar businesses.

We're experienced founders who have built and sold multiple businesses in the past. Origin is the most ambitious idea we've tackled to date (hopefully on the right side of crazy). We currently have a working MVP built on Ethereum and IPFS. We're looking for all sorts of people to join our team, whether you code in react, python or solidity. We're a distributed team and open to remote.

Ping us at founders@originprotocol.com if you're interested.

items.title: Management Consultant. Software Project Delivery | Munich, Germany
items.content:
*HOW WILL A TYPICAL DAY BE SPENT?*

* Engaging with developers, change professionals, business analysts and project managers.
* Executing proof of concepts before architecting and deploying appropriate technical solutions.
* Using your business acumen to ensure technical implementations are fit for purpose.
* Designing, implementing and testing component reusability models.
* Supporting clients, giving demos, training, mentoring, providing consultancy services.
* Showcasing solutions, outlining benefits, identifying potential future business opportunities.

*WHAT'S THE WORKING CULTURE LIKE?*

Passionate, driven, ambitious, collaborative. Personal career journeys are firmly aligned to the corporate roadmap. Big company ambitions with a small company feel. Consultants are fiercely loyal to the company and this is borne out by a very low attrition rate.

*WHAT'S INTERESTING ABOUT THE ROLE?*

In many ways you will feel like your own boss. You will need to be independent, flexible and able to travel extensively throughout Europe and across the globe. The role will bring lots of autonomy including a significant opportunity for remote working.

*WHAT ARE THE CHALLENGES?*

If you enjoy the formal structure of a corporate environment then this is not for you. You will need be self-motivated and versatile enough to wear multiple hats i.e. consultant, project manager, business analyst, technician, mentor, adviser. You will have a network of consultants to support you in the early days but thereafter you will be expected to stand on your own two feet.

*WHAT'S MY BACKGROUND?*

You come from a technical hands-on development (.NET, Java, C# or similar) environment and be looking to move (or have recently moved) into a more strategic, consultative, client-facing role such as business analysis or project management.

*PROGRESSION?*

This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of an exciting success story and to grow with a company that has world-class ambitions. In many ways progression will be what you make it.

*WHAT ARE THE NUMBERS?*

Up to EUR 85,000 + excellent benefits + share options.

items.title: Creative Manager/ Director (paid in Equity)
items.content:
Creative Manager

About us

We are an award winning dating app, www.clikapp.com who cater for creatives. We won an award at the UK DatinG Awards for Innovation, were listed as one of the best dating apps for men 2017 in the telegraph and have enjoyed some great traction. We are now looking for a creative director / manager to help us keep on brand cool, creative and fun. We are a startup, so we want someone who is keen to join us on this journey.

I should say that we are fundraising at the moment, and as such have limited funds, which is why we are keen to bring someone in who is keen to enter the world of startups and wants to grow with the company, payment will be in the form of equity within the company and we will cover expenses and travel to and from the office so you are not out of pocket. However this is for someone who is looking to the future or wants to gain some experience in startups. Please check out our website – www.clikdapp.com we have an incredibly strong team and are looking for someone who can join very quickly and muck in and get involved.


Ideal experience


You’ll be entrepreneurial by nature and have experience of being a creative leader, this could be in film/ photography/ graphic design or marketing.
Experience of working as a photographer and have links into the photographic community would be ideal.
You will understand how to interact with photographers and to judge good quality photography.
Be creative and clever and have a quick wit, we want someone who can bring some spark to our creative department.
Will be able to manage others well, and be willing to manage interns, assess work and give feedback.
The spirit and approach of an entrepreneur with very strong commercial acumen in order to deliver real value in a small business environment
Strong communication skills and the ability to build strong working relationships internally and with our marketing partners
Ideally but not essential direct experience of the UK dating or social networking environment.


The Role
Will be working alongside the founder and we want someone who will work 3-5 days a week, we will consider both fulltime and part time roles depending on the candidate and their skill set we may have flexibility for someone who has another role or is consulting.


Message from the founder.
We have a strong team and a great product, and we are looking for someone who wants to come on this exciting journey with us. We believe this company has what it takes to become a superstar so we want to surround ourselves with people who are willing to sacrifice to be part of it. We value hard work, entrepreneurial spirit and out the box thinking mentality. There will be a whole range of jobs for you to get involved in, some fun, some not so much but you want to work in startups so this is the game.. But if this sounds like you, drop us an email and lets grab a coffee and have a chat.

items.title: Business Development Manager
items.content:
TheMove.com is a pre launch prop tech startup that provides lead generation services for brokers and developers in the real estate industry. Our lead generation model is ready to disrupt a $500bn market for the better and after successful trials in three continents we are ready to build a team to launch in New York.


The Position

We are looking for a seasoned consultative salesperson with next-level interpersonal awareness and the ability to work with the founding team in developing our business in New York City.

As the Business Development Manager in our NYC office, you will be responsible for implementing the onboarding process for new brokers and property developers and undertaking an account management role for current clients. Whether you’re meeting with Sales Associates or Directors, you must be comfortable pitching our idea and acting as an evangelist for TheMove!

A previous background in real-estate or the property industry is highly desirable, however not essential.
The role will likely involve travel across the country and occasional remote working.


Role responsibilities

Business Development: Developing and building out our commercial proposition to both customers and real estate agents, owning the adoption and onboarding process.

Customer Experience: Developing our customer proposition and owning the customer experience, from customer service to the sales funnel

Operational Execution: Playing a lead role in the operational execution within your area, from corporate development (presentations, finances, legals) to our city-by-city rollout activation strategy to highly challenging operational tasks such as overseeing the management of our cutting 24/7 Virtual Assistant function.

KPI Focused: To work alongside the Country Manager to design key performance indicators that can be implemented across the NYC market.

Passion for working in an exciting tech-startup and willingness to go the extra mile.

Startups are challenging, hardworking and unstructured environments – they are not for everyone!


In return you will receive:

A chance to make a direct impact to the success of the business from day one, we have global ambitions and success will be rewarded by rapid progression

A competitive salary DOE

A great coworking office in Williamsburg

Please email a CV and cover letter to recruitment@themove.com
Please include within the letter your earliest start date.

items.title: Program Consultant, Program Placement Team
items.content:
Program Consultant, Program Placement Team - Jobmote

Program Consultant, Program Placement Team

Remote Year

Remote Year

Remote Year curates communities of interesting professionals, entrepreneurs, and freelancers from across the globe to spend either 4 or 12 months together working, traveling, and exploring cities around the world. Programs spend one month in each location, connecting with local cultures and business ecosystems, while forming lifelong, personal and professional relationships along the way. Together we will shape the future of work.

Role Description

Remote Year’s Program Placement team is searching for experienced consumer sales representatives, who we call Program Consultants, to match potential participants with the right Remote Year itinerary and community. Our Program Consultants act as the face of Remote Year to our customers, they are responsible for filling each community we launch. You will readily bring your drive, empathy, and consultative sales skills to this role. Ideally, you love being coached to succeed and working with your teammates to surpass all of your goals.

Responsibilities:

  • By deploying our sales process, best practices, systems, and deep product knowledge you lead our customers through an inclusive consultative sales process.
  • Build strong relationships through clear honest communication with both our customers and the Program Placement Team.
  • Actively collect data on your performance to grow. Using Salesforce, you track every lead in your pipeline and know immediately which leads to prioritize.
  • As a salesperson, you are accountable to daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly goals.
  • Undergo extensive sales development and coaching to perfect your performance at any point in the conversion process.
  • Use all of the sales tools given to you and provide consistent feedback to your managers on process functionality.

What You Bring:

  • Minimum 1-3 years experience in consumer sales.
  • Experience with Salesforce or another CRM.
  • Ability to perform at a high level, in a fast pace startup work environment.
  • Amazing communication skills and willingness to accept constructive feedback.
  • A coachable and adaptable mindset.

Preferred Qualification:

  • Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution.
  • Experience selling with a fully distributed team.
  • Experience in an inbound sales environment.

Remote Year’s Program Placement team is searching for experienced consumer sales representatives, who we call Program Consultants, to match potential participants with the right Remote Year itinerary and community. Our Program Consultants act as the face of Remote Year to our customers, they are responsible for filling each community we launch. You will readily bring your drive, empathy, and consultative sales skills to this role. Ideally, you love being coached to succeed and working with your teammates to surpass all of your goals.

Responsibilities:

  • By deploying our sales process, best practices, systems, and deep product knowledge you lead our customers through an inclusive consultative sales process.
  • Build strong relationships through clear honest communication with both our customers and the Program Placement Team.
  • Actively collect data on your performance to grow. Using Salesforce, you track every lead in your pipeline and know immediately which leads to prioritize.
  • As a salesperson, you are accountable to daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly goals.
  • Undergo extensive sales development and coaching to perfect your performance at any point in the conversion process.
  • Use all of the sales tools given to you and provide consistent feedback to your managers on process functionality.

What You Bring:

  • Minimum 1-3 years experience in consumer sales.
  • Experience with Salesforce or another CRM.
  • Ability to perform at a high level, in a fast pace startup work environment.
  • Amazing communication skills and willingness to accept constructive feedback.
  • A coachable and adaptable mindset.

Preferred Qualification:

  • Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution.
  • Experience selling with a fully distributed team.
  • Experience in an inbound sales environment.

Apply for this position

items.title: Product Development Manager
items.content:
We are seeking a veteran, process-oriented Product Manager to become a key member of our product leadership team. Working with existing product team, you will help act as the interface between a globally dispersed team of developers, QA professionals and members of a remote, sales-driven organization.

You will be responsible for balancing needs between infrastructure and product development requirements. You will work with stakeholders and product team members to collect, understand, and translate the business needs of our internal and external clients into technical language for your development team. You will share ownership over the product roadmap and be responsible for forecasting and maintaining on-time delivery of roadmap items.

You will work with a team that is charged with helping to increase the profitability of existing products and to develop new products for the company. You will build products from existing ideas, and help to develop new ideas based on your industry experience and your contact with customers, prospects, and internal clients. You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; have big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You must enjoy spending time in the market to understand its problems and find innovative solutions.

You must be able to communicate efficiently and effectively up, down, and laterally within and without our organization. You will work with an engineering counterpart to define product release requirements and with the company marketing team to define the go-to-market strategy, and help them understand the product positioning, key benefits, and target customers. You will also serve as the internal and external evangelist for your product offering, often working with the sales team and key customers/partners.
Responsibilities:

Gain a deep understanding of customer experience to identify and fill product gaps
Generate new ideas that grow market share, improve customer experience, and drive growth
Work with all stakeholders to prioritize and define features and tasks, aligned with strategic initiatives and business drivers
Evaluate competitor and technology landscape and identify niche opportunities that leverage our product line’s strengths and other weaknesses
Assess market competition by comparing the company's product to competitors' products.
Provide information for management by preparing short-term and long-term product success forecasts, special reports and analyses, and answer questions and requests.
Drive a solution set across development teams (primarily Development/Engineering and Marketing) through market requirements, product contracts, and positioning.
Propel product launches forward by working with the public relations team, executives, and other members of the management team
Translate product strategy into detailed requirements
Identify and provide solutions for unique client requirements without completely diverging from the roadmap and product vision
Brainstorm with the management team and contribute to the creation and maintenance of a product-line strategy and roadmap
Work closely with engineering teams to deliver quick time-to-market solutions

Skills and Experience
6+ years of Product Management/Project Management experience
Experience in a technology driven product environment, preferably SaaS product, B2B or B2C
Experience building SaSS based business models within the product; onboarding, billing, plan management, etc.
Technology background in SQL and Ruby on Rails
Experience working with API’s and integrating with third party API’s
Able to quickly learn new technological environments and keep updated on industry trends
Experience working with remote teams – a plus
Proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle
Proven ability to align/develop product and marketing strategies and effectively communicate recommendations to executive management
Strong problem solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Product management experience in a SaaS, cloud, or marketing software environment
Clear and precise communications skills, and ability to work with remotely distributed teams
Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies
BS/BA required in Computer Science or a related technical field, MBA a plus
Strong background in analyzing multiple data sets, demonstrating the ability to understand key performance drivers and ability to execute against findings
Strong technical architectural understanding of mobile and web products
Must have experience working with design and engineering teams to deliver end to end products
Strong understanding of UX best practices and ability to craft well thought out wireframes to communicate ideas effectively to development team as well as stakeholders.
A team-player attitude with willingness to get all hands on deck and roll up sleeves to achieve the best result

Head of Sales & Agency Growth at Lobster

London, Remote · Full Time

Business Development, Digital Media, Social Media, Networking, Sales, Ad Agency, Sales Strategy and Management, Social Media Marketing, Advertising, Twitter, Sales and Marketing, Communication Skills, Revenue Growth, Blogger Relations, Knowledge Management, Subscription Models, Agency Management, Growth Hacking, Love for Creativity, Account Management, Fluent in English
Compensation
£24K–£40K
1.0%–3.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

This is a business development role working with the digital media agency & publishers industry. Meaning you need to talk great and write great, and most importantly, make agencies, media and publishers subscribe for Lobster.

Lobster is looking for a person experienced in working with (or better off within!) digital media, advertising agencies and creatives of all sorts. This is a very important role for us great dedication and a share option in the company, it is almost a co-founder role.

We have developed an outstanding tool for the agencies and publishers to find exactly right social media visual content and license it for work from the authors. Now we are turning it into the whole world’s honest place to access real people’s content and it’s your turn to come on stage and reach all the agencies that need it.

Launched on TechCrunch Disrupt Battlefield Europe 2014, Graduate of Wayra UK accelerator 2014, raised £1m in 2017, reached 6 million photos and videos immediately available with the help of AI, first great agency subscribers and brands – waiting for you to grow the global customer side!

We can only consider people in London and settled in the UK to join the team at this time, even though you may be in office only occasionally.

items.title: Business Development Manager
items.content:
Business Development Manager at Novanet

Mumbai, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Sales, Lead Generation, Consultative Selling, Technology Selling
Compensation
₹300K–₹500K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

Novanet is seeking full-time business development professionals for its domestic and international sales organisation in five cities i.e. Mumbai, Bangalore, Hyderabad, Delhi and Chennai.

Sales at Novanet is about consistently meeting customer requirements. We firmly believe in enriching customer experience by ensuring the quick deployment and easy-adoption of our products. The team is responsible for establishing and nurturing customer relationships.

PREFERRED WORK EXPERIENCE

0-2 Years

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

- You will be responsible for finding out key contacts from your region, networking and initiating dialogues with seasoned IT professionals.

- As a sales professional, you will be expected to conduct meetings with such decision makers and generate interest by providing value propositions for our amazing product lineup.

-Your role as an account executive will extend to customer success management as well. You will be involved in various cross-sell/up-sell opportunities and ensure timely collection of revenue.

-You will get to work closely with the Marketing Team to define lead generation campaigns, customer profiling and market surveys.

WHY NOVANET SALES?

- Novanet has an amazing incentive structure that makes sure that you collect your incentives as long the customer generates revenue for Novanet.

- We place no restriction targeting potential customers across the globe.

- We offer an above-average industry standard compensation and domestic/international travel opportunities.

WHAT DO YOU NEED?

- Although, a passion for sales overcomes every educational qualification, but for academic purposes we will be accepting graduates with 0-2 yrs experience.

- Candidates with technical background or interest in latest technologies shall also be preferred

- Excellent communication and inter-personal Skills.

- Having personal conveyance is encouraged for intra-city travelling.
